content: The ancient city of Troy was located in what modern-day country?

The ancient city of Troy was located in what is now Turkey. Troy was an important city in the Bronze Age and is famous for being the setting of the Trojan War, which was chronicled in Homer's epic poem, the Iliad. The site of Troy has been excavated multiple times, revealing layers of occupation dating back to the 3rd millennium BCE. Today, the archaeological site of Troy is a UNESCO World Heritage site and a popular tourist destination in Turkey.
